quiz.text: Person M, N, J, and L worked together on a work in the first hour, while person O and K worked together to demolish the same work in the second hour. If this work continues till the work gets completed. Then, find the time (in hours) taken to complete the work by these persons.
options: None of these

quiz.text: If person P can do 35% more work in one hour as M can do in one hour, while person Q can do 20% less work in one hour as N can do in one hour. O started working alone and after some time he left the work, and the remaining work is completed by P and Q together in 13.25 hours more than time for which O worked. Then find the total time in which work is completed. (Approximately)
options: 20.91 hours
17.55 hours
23.72 hours
11.11 hours
None of these

quiz.text: If all six persons work together on the work, then find the time taken by all the persons to complete the whole work.
options: hours
hours
hours
hours
None of these

quiz.text: A and D starts work together with 100% of their original efficiencies and A left the work ‘x’ minutes before completion of the work. If D completed the remaining work with 125% of its original efficiency and whole work is completed in 48 minutes, then find the value of ‘x’?
options: 8 minutes
12 minutes
9 minutes
10 minutes
7 minutes

quiz.text: If efficiency of person B is equal to that of 3 women together and efficiency of 1 woman is equal to that of 4 boys together, then in what time person B, 9 women and 12 boys together will complete the work?
options: 24 minutes
18 minutes
30 minutes
22 minutes
20 minutes

quiz.text: Aman and Suman alone can do 3/4th and 2/3rd of a work in 36 days individually. If Suman and Gagan together can do the same work in ___days and they have together their efficiency 12 units per day. Then in___ days Aman, Suman and Gagan will complete the whole work, if they work in alternate days, starting with Gagan, after that Suman and then Aman respectively?
options: 58 days, 62 days
36 days,62 days
65 days, 36 days
44 days, 54 days
None of these

quiz.text:
4 persons P, Q, R and S together can finish a work in 12 hours while P alone can finish it in _____ hours. If R can work as destructor with same efficiency and R and S together (R as destructor) can do that work in 120 hours. Ratio of efficiency of R to S is 3: 4 and time taken by Q and S together to do that work is ____ hours.

Which of the following value will fill the blanks given in the question in the same order?

A: 80 and 20

B: 60 and 24

C: 48 and 30

D: 120 and 20
options: Only B and D
Only A and C
Only A and B
Only C and D
Only A, B and D

quiz.text: 10 men can complete a work in _________ days and 15 women can complete the same work in __________. A man and a woman together can complete the work in 90 days. Which of the following values will fill the blanks in the same order? (The efficiency of each man is the same and the efficiency of each woman is the same.) (A) 13.50 and 18 (B) 15 and 20 (C) 15.75 and 14 (D) 6.25 and 30
options: A only
Both B and C
Both A and C
A, C and D all three
B only

quiz.text: 15 men or 20 women can complete a task in 108 (1/3) days, while 25 men and 75 women together can complete it in P days. Deepak can do an assignment in (1.5P – 10) days, while Deepa can do the same assignment in 0.8P days. They started the work together and after Q days Deepak left, the remaining assignment completed by Deepa in 7 days. Find the value of P is how much percentage more or less than that of Q.
options: 400%
250%
300%
200%
None of these

quiz.text: Two persons Amit and Babu can do work in 20 days and 30 days respectively and a third person Chinmay can break the same work in 36 days. Chinmay starts his work and after sometime, Chinmay leaves work and remaining work is completed by Amit and Babu. If the total time taken from the beginning is 20 days then after ______ days Chinmay left his work?
options: 15 days
12 days
8 days
6 days
None of these

quiz.text: T1, T2, T3 and T4 can do a job together in  8/3 days. Time taken by T2 alone to complete the job is 2 days less than T4, while T2 is 87.5% more efficient than T1. Time taken by T3 and T4 together to complete the work is 60/11 days. M = Find time taken by T2 and T3 together to complete the job. N = Find time taken by T5 to complete the job alone, if T2 and T5 together complete the job in 3 days. L = If T4 worked at twice of its efficiency and T1 worked at 75% of its efficiency, then find time taken by both together to complete the work.
options: M > N > L
M = N < L
M < N = L
M = N > L
M < N > L

quiz.text: 16 men working 8 hours a day can complete a work in 5 days. In how many days 8 men and 10 women working 6 hours a day can finish the work? (Efficiency of men = 3 units per hour)
options: Ratio of efficiency of men to women is 3:2
12 women and 12 men working 5 hours a day can finish the work in 6 2/5 days.
8 women work 6 hours a day for 15 days. Remaining work is finished by 12 men working 3 1/3 hrs. days in 4 days.
12 men and 15 women working 5 hours a day will finish the work faster than 9 men working 6 hours a day and 16 women working 5 hours a day.
None of these

quiz.text: Total amount of work is 120 units. How many days are needed by A and C to complete the work together? I. A completes the work in 20 days. B completes 50% of the same work in 15 days. II. Ratio of efficiency of B to C is 1:2. The efficiency of C to D is 8:5. III. Efficiency of A to B is 3:4. IV. A and B complete the work in 12 days and D completes the same work in 24 days.
options: Only I is sufficient
II and either I or IV is sufficient
Only III is sufficient
Only IV is sufficient
Only II is sufficient.

quiz.text: A, B and C together can complete a piece of work together in 45 days. A and C together can complete the work in 67.5 days. B is 33.33% more efficient than A. Which of the following statements is true to the data given above? I. If B worked with 50% efficiency, A with 133.33% efficiency, and C worked with 100% more efficiency so work is completed in 33.75 days. II. If C is worked as a negative worker, work is completed in 270 days. III. If, A and C continuously working, B is working every 2nd day then work is completed in 53 days.
options: I only
I and III only
I and II only
II and III only
All are true.

quiz.text: 6 women and 5 men together can do a piece of work in 20 days, while 12 men and 8 women together can do the same work in 11 (4/11) days. Find which of the following statements is true?
options: Working efficiency of 2 men is 40% more than a woman
4 men can do the same task in 50 days
5 women can do the same task in 60 days
Ratio of efficiency of a woman is 25% more than a man
None of these

quiz.text:
Quantity I: 8 men can complete a work in 8 days, 12 women can complete the work in 4 days and 12 children complete the work in 5 days. If 16 men, 8 women and 5 children complete the whole work in x days, then find the value of x.

Quantity II: A and B together complete the work in 3 days and B and C together complete the work in 5 days. If A, B and C together complete the work in 2.5 days, then find the time taken by A and C together to complete the whole work.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity II > Quantity I
Quantity II ≥ Quantity I
Quantity I = Quantity II or Relation cannot be established

quiz.text:
Quantity I: 15 men can complete a work in 18 days. 24 women can complete the work in 20 days. In how many days 12 men and 16 women can complete the work?

Quantity II: A, B and C can complete the work in 7 1/17 days. B and C can complete the work alone in 24 days and 30 days respectively. Find the number of days taken by A alone to complete the work?

Quantity III: P and Q together can complete the work in x days. P alone can complete the work in (x + 4) days and Q alone can complete the same work in 15 days. Find the number of days taken by P alone to complete the work?
options: <, <
>, >
<, >
>, <
=, =

quiz.text: Heena and Beena together can complete a job in 48 days while Beena and Meena together can complete a job in 36 days. Heena start the work and left after 14.4 days after that Beena joined and left after 21.6 days. Meena completed the remaining work in 31.2 days.   Quantity I. In how many days Meena complete the whole work alone? Quantity II. In how many days Heena complete the whole work alone?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I < quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II

quiz.text:
Quantity I: A is 66.67% more efficient than B. Both of them together can complete a work in 18 days. In how many days B alone can complete the work?

Quantity II: If A can complete a work in 150 days, in how many days can he complete 33.33% of the same work?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation cannot be established.

quiz.text: Quantity I: No. of days in which P will work alone, given P and Q can complete work in 12 days, Q and R can complete work in 16 days, and R and P can complete work in 12 days.  Quantity II: No. of days in which P will work alone, given P and Q can complete work in 12 days, they started work together and after working for 8 days P left and Q completed the remaining work in 22 days.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation cannot be established.

quiz.text: B is 200% as efficient as A and C is 60% as efficient as B. A and C started a work together and left the work after completing 73(1/3) % part of work. If the remaining work is completed by B alone in 3.2 hours, then in what time A, B and C together will complete 7/8 part of the work?
options: 3 hours
5 hours
7 hours
4 hours
6 hours

quiz.text: K workers can do a piece of work in (3.5K – 2) days while (K – 6) workers can complete 25% of same work in 5K/3 days. Find what percentage of work completed by (K – 2) workers in 36 days?
options: 75%
50%
45%
80%
None of these

quiz.text: Efficiencies of Sunil and Raj are respectively 120% and 180% of that of Ajay. Ajay and Sunil together started a work and left after completed 11/18 part of work and remaining work is completed by Raj and Anil together. If total work is completed in 7(16/27) hours and Ajay alone can finish it in 18 hours, then efficiency of Anil is what per cent of that of Ajay?
options: 60%
95%
80%
90%
75%

quiz.text: Bunny is thrice efficiency as Sunny, and Munny is 75% more efficient than Bunny. Bunny, Sunny and Munny together can complete the work in 126/74 days. Find the difference between times taken to complete the work by Bunny and Munny together and Sunny and Munny together?
options: 72/255 days
81/275 days
84/275 days
94/275 days
None of these

quiz.text: There are four persons A, B, C, and D, time taken by B alone to complete the work is K days and A takes 12 days less than B to complete the work alone. C is 2/15 less efficient than B and D is 100% more efficient than C. if A start the work alone and after 15 days B joins him, after another 5 days both A and B left the work and remaining work completed by D in 12(3/26) days. Find the number of days by D to complete 13/15 part of work alone?
options: 52 days
24 days
39 days
13 days
None of these
